column2: had it with femring, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: sever stomach pain with  sever vaginal itching and burning...sent me to er x2 with symptoms of speech problem to racing heart came out of my body black in color!! I was toxic for several months on medicals still.

column2: Brenda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I first used the ring, the vaginal atrophy disappeared and sexual intercourse became pleasurable again.  the ring was uncomfortable, though.  it felt too big and pressed on my bladder giving me the feeling of needing to urinate all the time. Those feelings got better but still I was always aware that the ring was there, slightly uncomfortable. After Inserting the second ring, I started having bleeding after sexual intercourse and had a very disturbing discharge. I finally went to the doctor and was given clindamycin to treat a vaginal bacterial infection.  I was told that the Femring had caused erosion in my vaginal wall and it was removed immediately.  the dosage was too high for me and the ring was too big for me....   I have been given vaginal cream now to help with the dryness.  hopefully, this works.   I loved that the Femring gave me sexual pleasure again but understand that every person is different and in the end, it did not work for me.

column2: pilotmom2011, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a partial hysterectomy at 35 and then my ovaries removed 4 years later.  I tried everything but until I discovered the Femring, there were no answers!  I had hot flashes, dry vagina (sex was miserable) and I always felt "off."  Once I discovered the Femring and started using it, everything changed.  No more hot flashes, sex is incredibly fun again...I'm 55 years old and I have the sex drive I had at 25.  I am thrilled with the results; I have an active sex life; my boyfriend says that he can feel the ring occasionally but never enough to bother him and I never know it's in, except that intercourse is never uncomfortable anymore!  Greatest thing ever invented!

column2: artglassqueen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have used t his to counter vaginal atrophy. Although I am 64 my husband and I still enjoy sexual activity. The Femring has enabled my vagina to regain the natural lubrication necessary for painless intercourse,

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried low-dose patches but they always fell off.  I have been on Femring 0.5 mg. for 4 months.  I just removed the Femring because I am breaking out all over my chin and feel very nervous - almost, but not quite like drinking too much coffee.  I think I'll go back to the lowest strength patch and figure out some way to keep it from falling off.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: bturner1108, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: My experience with Femring has been very effective and satisfying because it has really work for me. It has helped with my vagnial dryness and it has worked wonders for the my hot flashes. I really like using the Femring Treatment.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: Wanda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 54 years old; I have been using fem-ring for more than two years -- prescribed 0.5 mg -- changed ring every three months. This past month, I developed intermittent abdominal, low back, and side pain with occasional vaginal discharge; escalated into chronic abdominal pain with fever, chills, nausea, and skin rash, with constant discharge. I removed and discarded the fem ring. Pain, fever, and chills quickly subsided; discharge decreased. White blood cell count had escalated. Apparently, my body was rejecting the ring as it was trying to embed itself. My gynecologist has prescribed an antibiotic suppository treatment for infection. It has been four days since I removed the ring; I have been on the antiobiotic for only one night, and have not experienced the low back, side, and abdominal pain as before removing it.

column2: Shelsbud, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started on the Femring in late October after a Total Abdominal Hysterectomy-Bilateral Salpingo-Oopherectomy the previous month.  Within days my hot flashes disappeared. It took about three weeks for the depression to go away. It's been relatively easy to use but don't have anything to compare it to since it's my first experience with HRT. There have been a couple of occasions when I was constipated and strained bowl movements caused the ring to almost slip out. (I now always check before flushing.)Frequent external vaginal yeast infections have been uncomfortable but I didn't link it to the ring until just recently; the informational sheet provided by the pharmacy lists it as a possible side effect.  A replacement ring is due in a few days and I'll be tracking the frequency of my yeast infections.  The infections seem to happen every couple of weeks and are controlled with external over-the-counter yeast infection treatments.

column2: sastified, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Surgical menopause at age 37, w/removal of ovaries, and on prescription oral estrogens until six years ago, when I switched to the Femring. Am now 58. Libido is stronger than ever, and vaginal dryness is non-existent, especially during intercourse. Enjoy an excellent sex life, including oral. The ring does not interfere with penetration, nor does my partner notice the ring. Only two minor cons: Nothing has ever helped with occasional hot flushes, including the ring; on two occasions in the past several months, after my partner has removed himself, the ring came out with him. My guess is that this may be due to the increased amount of moisture in the vagina.

column2: ms. ross, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on the ring for 1 month. Within 2 weeks of being on the ring I had a menstral that lasted 4 days. I had not had one of those in years, but I got through. I have also experienced some shoulder pain which is minor. I have been unable to sleep for the last 4 years and now I can sleep like a normal person. I know it's only been a month but it is working for me. No hot flashes at all at any point of the day. I haven't had any problems with having sex while having the ring inside. I am 37 and have a long hall ahead of me with hormone replacements. So far so good!

column2: Rose, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used HRT for the last 13 years,since having a hysterecotomy, but find Femring to be the best, it gets the job done. I started out at the highest dosage, but have since cut back to the lowest dosage.  No problems, I love this product, but it is pricey. I have RX insurance but stills have to pay 50.00 every three months.  I am 61 years old.

column2: Halle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Someone else here said the ring was too big for them. I have the same problem. After just a day of wearing it, I had to take it out because it was so uncomfortable. I was always aware it was there. I wish it had been more comfortable because other than that, I really liked how it worked for me, better than oral meds and skin patches.

column2: VeryHappyFemRingUser, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: @39yo (1990)had hysterectomy retaining ovaries. 1yr later,blood test confirmed I was in menopause(trama to ovaries during surgery,often a side effect triggering menopause). Started oral Rx (premarin low dose). About 1995,dropped oral Rx & moved to FemRing(after unsatisfactory trial of Estrace cream (cream worked but was messy).I have LOVED FemRing! Husband & I enjoy oral sex and vaginal penatration sex without problem. Retaining it in place is good reminder to practice daily Kegal exercises. It maintains good vaginal moistness and I only had one yeast infection in all these yeears, due to taking Amoxicillin for sinus infection(won't do that again!).Seems to help maintain a healthy PH of my vagina with comfortable moistness. I was just told @ Sept 09 yrly GYN that I need to switch in another yr or two to the 'cream' inserted by application tube,since I am approaching 60yo and have been on HRT replacement long enough.I am not looking forward to the 'messy' cream discharge,etc. to continue to maintain comfort to the vaginal walls. I have no cancer history on either side of my family. I get yearly mammo's - always negetive and do self breast exams (in the shower during soapy breast washing)besides monthly or so in the bed.

column2: denise, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am 48 years old and have been using the femring for 6years.  I would give it 10 stars if possible. My husband can even tell when the 3mon are almost up due to my personality changes. I have no more hot flashes or night sweats. I don't no why more doctors do not perscribe this.  It is the easiest method I have found. A life changer.

column2: ariat10530, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy in 99 and ovary removal in 03 at age 36 I went into surgical menopause I tried different HRT's with different side effects. I tried the Femring and have been extremely satisfied. I do not have to remember anything except  to replace every 3 months! I do worry about the safety of HRT but at 42 I  really  dont have a choice,

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: Penny G., 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It's the best thing that ever happened to me-my libido improved, as did vaginal dryness, and no more moodiness, night sweats, or hot flashes.  My doctor finally made me stop it due to risk of breast cancer which runs in my family. I have been told by a breast surgeon that my age alone makes my chances of breast cancer more risky than the Femring.  However, I want to get back on it because my quality of life right now is more important to me. Having a wonderful sexual relationship with my partner is something I enjoy.

column2: hotmama,  Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 43 years old and had a total abdominal hysterectomy/bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 5 years ago and have tried just about everything on the market, including bioidentical compounded creams and nothing helped.  Pills cause horrible mood swings and I have fluctuations on the patches and they do not last the time they are supposed to.  Fluctuations were horrible with hormone injections.  The Femring is the only thing that has helped me have any normal quality of life.  The .1 was much too much and made me feel sick but the .05 is just right.  The only problem is that my symptoms come back at about the 7-8 week mark.  The ring costs me a fortune but I will sacrifice it to feel good again after all these years of hell.  For the person who said their levels were very high, what dose were you on?

column2: Frannie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy at 30.I started on Femring .025 or .05 at age 60 for hot flashes and hormones.I eliminated it for one year and had a trublent year.I am not 65 years old and still need to use.

column2: gormah, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: On the "ring" for over 8 years post hysterectomy.  Finally went to a doc that measured my hormone levels.  Found my estrogen was 10 times the norm (600mg as opposed to "normal" 66mg).  With a familial history of breast cancer on both sides (yes, even my father got breast cancer) I was appalled that no one had suggested a quantitative measurement before this.  So, that's my suggestion to you all.... get lab work done regularly to ameliorate any chance of an estrogen driven cancer being whipped into a frenzy by insanely high levels when not monitored.

column2: sherankk, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At 42 years old I was miserable due to menapause syptoms. Not sleeping, terrible hot flashes and mood swings. Within days of inserting Femring I could see a difference and by 10 days they were completely gone and I feel great again!!!

column2: missy123, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just started med. because i developed an allergy to enjuvia. effectiveness/satisfaction, time will tell.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is the best medication by far that I have tried post menopause... I've tried almost every pill and patch available and this is the only thing that has helped almost all my symptoms... I just wish it were more affordable!

column9: The Femring elevated my vaginal dryness and once again my husband & I enjoy a healthy sexual relationship. Within an hour of inserting the vaginal dryness was gone. I was a big anti HRT until this product was prescribed by my MD.

column2: healthy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It is much easier than taking a pill every day.  However, I am concerned about ovarian cancer, since that is a warning for the ring.  Initially, my breast were sensitive but not again.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had taken premarin for over 20 years and I began getting hot flashes and night sweats.  My doctor recommended this as an alternative. It helped with both, however it did not get rid of them. I also experienced additional sweating along the front of my neck, even though it was not the typical "flash".  I never knew when the sweat would start and once it started, it would run down the front and back, into my bra, etc.  Night sweats also began getting worse.  The overall worse part for me was putting it in and taking it out.  I managed to get it in, but embarrassingly, I had to go to my doctor to get it out.  I can't be bothered with that for the future.  I'm going back to pills, but trying something other than premarin.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: While it was very effective and easy to use for my symptoms, I had changes in my breasts that were not acceptable to me.  They were VERY sensitive, and seemed to get worse the longer I used it.

column2: marlanashelton, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am uncertain about vaginal infections, having sex, using a douche and other questions about the femring

column2: hindsight, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After having a tumor removed & hysterectomy & trying oral HRT the Dr suggested the Femring to help dryness and cut Rx costs.  I tried it for 3 weeks - it gave me an infection and disrupted my sex life terribly as my partner & I both enjoy oral sex.  If it works for you & you don't engage in oral sex I could see it being a good product - but it gives you something I didn't think about before hand.

column2: Kittin in Alaska, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 3x cancer survivor with allergies to all kinds of meds.  The femring has kept me on a even path.  With out the Femring no one can stand to be around me,let alone myself. My partner, he doesn't even feel it during intercorse.  Once in awhile we need a little gel do to be a little dry, but not often. The femring has been a God sent. If you ask me my feelings, 1 being poor and 10 being the greatest. I give it a 20. I have been on the Femring for 6 years now. I forget that it is even there. Thank you!

column2: Nola, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Tried pills, patches etc.  This is the best solution yet BUT I wish they made a smaller version.  I never had children so things are small down there.  Most of the time.. no problem but before sex I have to take it out and remember to put it back later.   If I don't take it out then climax causes muscle contractions that cause the thing to abrade the inside and make me bleed.  A LOT.   Taking it out works but there is no information from the company that I can find to tell me wether or not this might impact it's effectiveness.  (I wonder because since I have been doing this some mild hot flashes have come back even though I do put it right back hours later.)    I realize that a woman my age that has never been pregnant is a relative rarity but we do exist and it would be nice if there were smaller rings.  I am told by my doctor who diagnosed this problem that if they made all of them smaller they would have a problem of falling out.    One size does not fit all though.     Otherwise this is the perfect solution.  It works,  You only have to remember to change it every 3 months and otherwise you have to give it no thought.  As you get older you end up taking more pills and you worry about impact on your kidneys, liver, etc.. from all of them.  This is one less thing to swallow and that has to be a good thing.

column2: Marla, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a health care provider and this was the recommended method to help with my menopausel symptoms. I can insert this ring and not think about it again for 90 days.
